100191-79.Description: Zepp Health Corp is engaged in the business of manufacturing smart health wearable products. The company operates in two segments: Xiaomi Wearable Products and Self-branded products & others. The product portfolio includes smartwatches and fitness bands. The majority is from Self-branded products & other segments. It generates majority of the revenue from Xiaomi Wearable Products segment.

183205-63.Description: Developer of a brain stimulation headset designed to target both the physical and behavioral elements of major depressive disorder. The company's headset combines brain stimulation with behavioral therapy in a fully automated mobile application based on peer-reviewed scientific literature, enabling individuals to restore activity in brain cells resulting in a reduction of depressive symptoms.
183205-63.Keywords: behavioural therapy app, brain stimulation technology, depression recovery tools, depression tracking app, depression treatment, medtech company, neuro technology, portable therapy, wearable headset

Previously, the company joined Nordic Innovation House - Silicon Valley on an undisclosed date. No equity or funding was exchanged as a result of this program.

458417-44.Description: Developer of metabolic health and fitness monitoring devices intended to help users transform themselves easily. The company's devices monitor environmental markers that affect users' health every day and allow them to track their meditation, body workouts, and bedtime, helping users to meditate, work, and optimize their sleep efficiently.
458417-44.Keywords: exercise training, fitness service, health and wellness, healthcare technology, metabolic health, personalized care, personalized nutrition, remote monitoring, self growth, wellness platform
458417-44.DescriptionShort: Developer of metabolic health and fitness monitoring devices intended to help users transform themselves easily.
458417-44.FinancingStatusNote: The company closed on $30 million of an undisclosed targeted amount of venture funding from SoftBank Group on October 22, 2024. Previously, the company raised INR 2.09 billion through a combination of debt and Series B3 venture funding in a deal led by Blume Ventures, Nexus Venture Partners and Steadview Capital Management on March 20, 2024, putting the company's pre-money valuation at INR 8.31 billion. Deepinder Goyal and Alpha Wave Global also participated in the round. The funds will be used to advance the company's growing portfolio of consumer health tracking products, expand the Indian company's manufacturing capabilities, and intensify its research efforts.

171678-43.Description: Developer of a comprehensive video recognition system designed to recognize video semantics automatically. The company's system utilizes deep learning and artificial intelligence technology to facilitate automatic video tagging and indexing, smart advertisement, video summarization, automatic monitoring and video and music recommendation, enabling broadcasting companies, video-sharing websites and surveillance system providers to recognize video content automatically for large-scale multimedia management.

64325-80.Description: Developer of a wearable performance optimization device intended to provide personalized insights to improve overall fitness. The company's device offers a continuous understanding of sleep, strain, and recovery to balance training, reduce injuries, and predict performance, enabling customers to understand their bodies and inner potential to avoid over-training.

61931-08.Description: Peloton Interactive Inc operates an interactive fitness platform. It operates its business in two reportable segments: Connected Fitness Products and Subscription. Connected Fitness Product revenue consists of bike and tread and related accessories sales, associated fees for delivery and installation, and extended warranty agreements. Subscription revenue is generated from monthly Connected Fitness Subscription and Digital Subscription. The company generates maximum revenue from the Subscription segment. Geographically, the company derives a majority of its revenue from North America and the rest from the International markets.
61931-08.Keywords: connected fitness equipment, cycling tools, fitness cycle, fitness tech, gym fitness, indoor cycling studio, integrated fitness, live boutique studio classes, live instructor
61931-08.Universe: Debt Financed, Private Equity, Publicly Listed, Venture Capital

61931-08.MarketInformation: The company's competitors include Bowflex, True Fitness Technology

56236-96.Description: Catapult Group International Ltd is a sports data and analytics company. Its principal activities include the sale of wearables subscriptions, wearable units, and hardware, the rendering of software services, and content licensing; all related to sports. The company's three main operating segments are Performance & Health, Tactics & Coaching, Media & Other. Maximum revenue is derived from the Performance & Health segment, which involves designing, developing, and supplying wearable technology and athlete monitoring software solutions to sports teams, athletes, & the prosumer market. Geographically, it derives key revenue from the EMEA ( Europe, Middle East, and Africa) region, and the rest from the USA, Asia Pacific, Australia, and other areas.
56236-96.Keywords: monitoring equipment, smart sportswear, sportswear, wearable technology, wearable technology device, wearable technology products
56236-96.DescriptionShort: Developer of wearable technology products designed to advance athlete performances.
56236-96.FinancingStatusNote: The company (ASX: CAT) received AUD 46.55 million of development capital from two directors and other undisclosed investors on June 24, 2021 through a private placement. The funds raised will be applied towards the strategic acquisition of leading sports software video solutions provider, SBG Sports Software, and plans to increase investment in technology, product, data science, and scale capacity, to accelerate the company's growth strategy.
56236-96.AllIndustries: Monitoring Equipment, Other Apparel, Personal Products

495718-39.Description: Developer of neuromodulation devices dedicated to improving lives through neuroscience. The company offers a non-invasive Vagus nerve stimulator for stress resilience and well-being by signaling the brain to release calming neurotransmitters like acetylcholine and serotonin, helping clients take care of their brain and mental health.
495718-39.Keywords: anxiety relief, neuromodulation device, neuromodulation therapy, neuromodulation therapy device, stress relief, stress relief product, therapeutic device, therapeutic tools

495718-39.FinancingStatusNote: The company raised EUR 2 million of venture funding from Scalewolf on February 21, 2025. Previously, the company raised EUR 400,000 of angel funding on an undisclosed date, putting the company's pre-money valuation at EUR 20 million.

494786-80.Description: Developer of a sports and entertainment media platform intended to offer merchandise for sports enthusiasts. The company's platform is focused on the come-ups & comebacks, helping athletes and artists share and monetize stories at scale through shows, brand partnerships and merchandise, enabling fans to get a front-row seat to the lives and grind of athletes.
494786-80.Keywords: merchandise, merchandise business, sports media, sports media company, sports merchandise, sports merchandise retailer
494786-80.DescriptionShort: Developer of a sports and entertainment media platform intended to offer merchandise for sports enthusiasts.
494786-80.FinancingStatusNote: The company was acquired by Better Collective (STO: BETCO) for EUR 38.86 million on July 3, 2023. The company will receive a contingent payout of EUR 23.97 million upon the achievement of certain performance thresholds and subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions. The company is no longer actively tracked by PitchBook. With the acquisition, Better Collective broadens its user base towards more generalist sports fans which subsequently increases the value offering to its existing partners.

110783-26.Description: Developer of a wellness wearable ring designed to track and improve sleep quality and performance. The company's product tracks sleep quality, stages, electrocardiogram (ECG) level resting heart rate and variability as well as body temperature during the night through an intelligent data-driven plan by detecting changes in blood pulse volume, enabling users to improve their sleep and overall health and align to their natural circadian rhythm.
110783-26.Keywords: connected healthcare, fitness tracker, heart rate tracker, sleep monitoring device, sleep screening, wearable device, wearable rings devices
110783-26.DescriptionShort: Developer of a wellness wearable ring designed to track and improve sleep quality and performance.
110783-26.FinancingStatusNote: The company raised $200 million of Series D venture funding in a deal led by Fidelity Management Group and DexCom on December 19, 2024, putting the company's pre-money valuation at $5 billion. Other undisclosed investors also participated in the round. The funds will be used to expand the company's product offerings and further invest in product, science, AI, and explore additional acquisitions.

142343-92.Description: Operator of a coaching enhancement kit brand intended for football players.
